Add Atomikos support classes <enter>  <enter> Add support classes for the Atomikos JTA library, including: <enter>  <enter> - A Spring friendly ConnectionFactoryBean and DataSourceBean. <enter> - A PostProcessor to apply 'depends-on' ordering automatically. <enter> - A bindable properties class for type-safe configuration. <enter>  <enter> See gh-947

Teach MockWebServer SPDY. <enter>  <enter> Kill MockSpdyServer in the process.

Support reactive web servers with LocalServerPort <enter>  <enter> This commit refactors the `EmbeddedWebServerInitializedEvent` hierarchy <enter> to have one specialized event for Servlet based apps and another one for <enter> reactive apps. <enter>  <enter> Each event implementation has: <enter>  <enter> * a specific `ApplicationContext` implementation for the app <enter> * a custom `getServerId` implementation that differentiates the <enter> application server from the management server <enter>  <enter> Closes gh-8348

Remove duplicate resources from classpath <enter>  <enter> We had been making a special case for logback.xml anyway, so <enter> extending that to simply deleting recursively all of <enter> src/main/resources (or equivalent) from target/classes (or <enter> equivalent) seems like it's perfectly justifiable. <enter>  <enter> Fixes gh-451

Add support for Restarting applications <enter>  <enter> Add Restarter class that can be used to restart a running application <enter> when underlying class files change. The Restarter is automatically <enter> initialized via a ApplicationListener and automatically detects <enter> classpath URLs that are likely to change (when not running from a fat <enter> jar). <enter>  <enter> See gh-3084

Improve diagnostics when OnBeanCondition type deduction fails <enter>  <enter> When @ConditionalOnBean or @ConditionalOnMissingBean are used on a <enter> @Bean method, they will, in the absence of any other configuration, <enter> attempt to deduce the bean's type by examining the method's return <enter> type. This deduction can fail. See gh-4841, gh-4934, and gh-5624 <enter> for some examples of possible failure causes. Previously, this <enter> failure was only logged as a debug message leaving the user with a <enter> misleading message suggesting that the @ConditionalOnBean or <enter> @ConditionalOnMissingBean annotation was not configured correctly. <enter>  <enter> This commit improves the diagnostics by mention the possibility of <enter> type deduction in the exception message and including the exception <enter> that caused deduction to fail as the cause. <enter>  <enter> Closes gh-4934

Add current AOSP class name for OpenSSLSocketImpl <enter>  <enter> AOSP moved OpenSSLSocketImpl to com.android.org.conscrypt.* so add that <enter> as the first choice for unbundled apps. <enter>  <enter> Change-Id: I7bad6533dcb86ee1cac3b15f42dd386bd651eaed

Mention that Lettuce requires commons-pool2 <enter>  <enter> We intend to remove this limitation in a future milestone but as the <enter> Lettuce auto-configuration requires `commons-pool2`, this commit updates <enter> the How-To to mention that. <enter>  <enter> See gh-9091

Support querying & setting transport lists on connections. <enter>  <enter> The list is specified via a magic request property <enter> 'X-Android-Transports' and can be queried via the request <enter> property 'X-Android-Selected-Transport'. <enter>  <enter> System wide defaults / switches don't need any changes <enter> to okhttp. They can be set as options on the OkHttpClient <enter> used by the platform UrlStreamHandlers.

Add mainClassName to springBoot DSL in Gradle plugin <enter>  <enter> This commit introduces a new mainClassName property on the springBoot <enter> DSL provided by the Gradle plugin. It can be used to explicitly <enter> configure the mainClassName of the default bootRun, bootJar, and <enter> bootWar tasks in a single place. Previously, the only mechanism <enter> provided to do so was the mainClassName property that's only available <enter> when the application plugin has been applied. <enter>  <enter> Closes gh-10623

Register an AuthenticationManager in security autoconfig <enter>  <enter> This is quite a big step, but I think it helps a lot. Since Spring <enter> Boot always creates an AuthenticationManager if it doesn't find one <enter> already registered, it makes sense to also make it into a @Bean. <enter> Spring Security does not register its AuthenticationManager by <enter> default though, so we have to do that for it if the user has created <enter> one with an @Autowired AuthenticationManagerBuilder, but not registered <enter> it as a @Bean. <enter>  <enter> Having the @Bean (marked @Primary to prevent issues with @Autowired) <enter> makes it easier to reason about what Spring Boot has done for you, and <enter> easier to default in simple use cases to the boot-created <enter> AuthenticationManager. For example, if I want an OAuth2 Authorization <enter> Server with password grant, it makes total sense for the <enter> AuthenticationManager for users to be the same as the @Primary one. <enter> Now it is easy to set that up (just @Autowire it).
